column4: hi folks, i'm running on the k7 kernel.  but in my software updates, i still see the non-k7 kernel packages for update.  any idea how to remove them?
depends which kernel shows up for update. if, for example, it's linux-server, do "sudo apt-get remove linux-server*" in a console
linux-image-2.6.15-26-386
oh, yea. my way wouldn't work anyway
together with linux-image-386, linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15-26-386 and linux-restricted-modules-386
:D
do "sudo apt-get remove linux-*-386"
really irritating to have those entries sticking out all the time
did a simulation.  it says only linux-386 will be removed.
doesn't seem rite
ok, do it the long way. sudo apt-get remove linux-image-2.6.15-26-386 linux-image-386 linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15-26-386 linux-restricted-modules-386
alrity.... here we go
purrfect :D
thx dud
s/dud/dude
no worries. :)
one more q.  any idea how to make a kde3 app look nicer?  i have installed qt-config but the L&F still looks odd
you're using kubuntu desktop, i assume?
nopes.  ubuntu.
ah, i see. i don't know how to do that; i'm a kubuntu man :)
darn :)
i don't know how ubuntu's default install deals with QT apps. someone here will know, though, I'm sure.
